channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Traffic camera citations
item.description: Traffic camera citations have been an open data source since may, though I just found it for the first time today.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m thinking of using the title ‘actionable figures’ I googled the results to see how original the title is: #code for returning google search results #use selenium or splash in the future for more reproducible scrape library(rvest) library(tidyverse) library(magrittr) library(RCurl) scrapeDate <- Sys.Date() search_term <- '"actionable figures"' url <- URLencode(str_c("https://www.google.com/search?q=", search_term,sep="")) fullResults <- (read_html(x=url)) messyLinks <- str_match_all(fullResults, "(.*?)<a href=\"/url\\?q=(http|https)://(.*?)\"") cleanLinks <- messyLinks[[1]] The google search on 2019-07-12 returned the following sites that have used the title:

item.title: About
